materials.raw_text:
Lithium carbonate (Li2CO3) - 6.25 g 
 Manganese(II) oxide (MnO) - 25 g 
 Nickel(II) oxide (NiO) - 35 g 
 Phosphorus pentoxide (P2O5) - 30 g 
 Scandium oxide (Sc2O3) - 1.25 g

sourcing.instructions:
Lithium carbonate can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online retailers specializing in battery materials. 
 Manganese(II) oxide can be purchased from chemical suppliers or materials science suppliers. 
 Nickel(II) oxide is available from chemical suppliers or online chemical retailers. 
 Phosphorus pentoxide can typically be found at chemical supply companies or specialty retailers. 
 Scandium oxide can be sourced from rare earth material suppliers or specialized online chemical retailers.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 
 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine 6.25 g of lithium carbonate, 25 g of manganese(II) oxide, 35 g of nickel(II) oxide, 30 g of phosphorus pentoxide, and 1.25 g of scandium oxide. 
 3. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to thoroughly mix the dry ingredients until a uniform powder is obtained. 
 4. Ensure there are no lumps and that the mixture has a consistent color and texture.

cooling.raw_text:
1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature gradually.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace and carefully extract the solidified material.
